text: Bottle shared at the Leighton tasting 08/06/2017. A clear golden orange coloured pour with a lasting loose white head. Aroma is mango peach, apricot, tangy orange rind,. Flavour is composed of Base malts orange rind, tangerine, mango. .. Crisp finish. Plate is semi sweet moderate carbonation, semi dry finish.

Unripe citrus fruits, grain and cereal malts, floral hops, light tropical fruits, mango. Hazy gold, small, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More tropical fruits, citrus flavours, sweet grain malts, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Nice Golden Ale..or APA whatever! Bottle shared at Leightons - thanks to mR_fr0g!

Bottle split at Hackney Levels, thanks to Fergoose, 08/06/17.
Lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is tangerine, mango, straw, grains, bready notes.
Taste comprises bubblegum, peach, tangerine, light spice, soft breads.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, drying close with a juicy hop closure.
Solid for style ... probably more APA than hote golde though!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - thanks to Fergus. Pours clear gold with a creamy, white head. The nose holds tangerine, pale bread, light pine. Light-medium sweet flavour with low bitterness, some crispy pale bread, tangerine. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Finishes with more crisp pale bread, mellow bitterness, tangerine, hay. Enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2017 Bottle at LKS.it pours lightly hazy golden - amber with a small white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, juicy, oily, woody, peachy, almond, brioche and candy. The taste is dry, bitter, oily, piney, fresh tangerine action, straw, pineapple, straw, light spice and a touch of alcohol. Finish is dry and fresh. Medium body and fine carbonation. Decent.
Bottle at home, 10th May 17. Pours golden. Aroma is apricot, peach, tropical fruit. Taste is peach, creamy, tropical fruit, light bitterness. Really enjoyable beer.

Bardzo dobrze nachmielone piwo. Czuć, że nie jest to IPA - jest jakby bardziej kremowe w smaku, mimo, że wcale nie ma jakoś specjalnie dużo ciała. Poza tym smaki mocno chmielowe, ale nie ziołowe - mieszanina suszonych owoców, jakieś kwiatowe nuty.Trochę za bardzo jak dla mnie wychodzi Galaxy, za którym nie przepadam.

Cask at St Albans Beer Shop, St Albans, UK. Colour is cloudy orange with medium white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, pine, hops. Taste is tropical fruit again, malts, citrus, sweet orange. Pine in the final.

14th June 2016Says on the bottle and the pumpclip - Simcoe Mosaic Equinox Galaxy, so this is SMEG bomb isnt it you scamps? Very hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light, mildly dry and has good fine carbonation. Light malts with thin creamy sweetness. Delightfully fruity and light hops - Mosaic blueberry, mild passion fruit, well integrated with mellow orange and mango. Light sweetish finish. Very clean and fruity.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Cloudy golden with a large white head. It has a sweet tropical fruit flavour followed by toffee, pine and more tropical fruit on the smooth finish. Very good.
Pours a cloudy orange with a thin white head. Aroma of sticky pine and malts. Flavour is hoppy, some lemon and orange. A nice golden ale.

Bottle. Hazy orange body with a thick white head. Good lacing. Aroma of caramel, honeydew melon and green mango. Flavour of green hops, papaya and biscuit. Medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. A very nice beer although the flavour doesnt quite live up to the aroma.

Bottle shared with the bro. Cheers James! Pours a hazed orange with a small white frothy head. Aromas of juicy melon, tropical fruits, and citrus. Flavour is tropical fruit, citrus, slight pepper hits with a biscuity pine linger.

On tap at the Commercial Rooms (JDW), Bristol 11/3/2016. Pale gold with a decent, white, head, and moderate fizziness. Tropical fruits, grassy hops, a touch of creamy malts, leading to a dryish finish with whiff of pine. Very good.

Ale House, Chelmsford, 24/3/2016, cheers for getting these ticks in.

Orange appearance. White lacing. Dropped bright. Lots of pine and pith on aroma. Taste is papaya, grapefruit, soft malts and a nice level of darkness. A solid session ale.

Cask in the Shakespeare Tavern, Sheffield. Pours golden with a frothy cream head. Mild tropical aroma. The taste has some nice tropical fruit flavours. Notes of mango, passionfruit and grapefruit. Not a brilliant finish with some sloghtly off bready notes coming through. Decent though.

Aroma of white pepper, raspberries and strawberries burst through a biscuity and rich nectarous veil. Hazy gold yellow with a dense just off-white, persistent creamy head. The fruit later gives way to general tropical citrus character in the aroma. The flavour isnt quite as impressive as the aroma, being quite muddled, but there is an apricot flavour and tropical citrus character being restrained by biscuity malt and the finish gives that white pepper flavour which is still very nice. Carbonation is ideal and cant really fault the texture.
